title: Test and troubleshoot a flow run
content:
After you have triggered a flow run, you can drill down into the run and investigate its progress in detail. This is particularly helpful if a flow run fails.

When you click Drill down  at the end of a row in the RUN EXPLORER, detailed information about the selected run display. You can also double-click a row to drill down to see this information.

To the left, the Run Tree displays the steps in the run and the transition messages. The Run Tree highlights the currently running step and displays information about the progress of the run. If a flow fails, you will see at which step the failure occurred. The steps and transition messages are automatically refreshed as the run progresses. 

There are a number of collapsible views that you can use to display different kinds of information:

  • Information about the flow—Flow ID, flow name, path, description, flow inputs, and flow outputs.

    Click the Down arrow  in the center of the RUN EXPLORER drill down view toolbar.

  • Information about a selected step in the flow—start time, end time, step result, duration, inputs, results, worker group, the ID of the worker that executed the step, and more. Click the Step Details tab.

    The Step Details tab displays details about the step that's currently running. If you select a step in the Run Tree, the Step Details tab displays details about the selected step.

    All sensitive data gets encrypted in memory and in the database during the run and later. The event is persistent and displayed as asterisks in the UI. This property propagates between elements. For example, if you had marked the step result as sensitive data, then the step result passes this behavior to every input/step result that's assigned from it. This includes sensitive data returned by a scriptlet.

    You can drag the slider on the left edge of the Flow Info pane to adjust its width.

  • A graphical view of the flow, with the currently running step, gets highlighted. Click the Flow Graph tab.

    The Flow Graph highlights the step that's currently running. If you select a step in the Run Tree, the Flow Graph highlights the selected step. You can adjust the way the flow graph displays:

    • by dragging it across the screen to view hidden items, or
    • by using the zoom to adjust the size of the image.

  • The Run Log—a table with information about the entire run (steps, start time, duration, inputs, results, and more), with the option to find a specific step.

    Click Run Log   to display the Run Log pane.

    If the run includes subflows, the steps in the subflows are indented in the run log.

    Click Run Tree   to collapse the Run Log pane and show the Run Tree.

    You can click  in the toolbar to toggle between viewing a selected step in the Run Tree and in the Run Log.

There are also cases where a run has no drill down details: If you had cleared the run details in the system.

User interface elements

RUN EXPLORER drill-down view toolbar

When you drill down to see the details of a flow run, the toolbar at the top remains constant, and the details displayed below vary according to your selections.

GUI item Description
Back   Click to return to the main RUN EXPLORER window.
Run Tree    Click to display the Run Tree pane, when the Run Log displays.
Run Log    Click to display the Run Log pane, when the Run Tree displays.
Run name Displays the name of the flow run.
Down arrow

Click to expand the Flow Info pane.
Status

Displays the status of the flow run:

Success or

Error

Run Tree

When you drill down to see the details of a flow run, the Run Tree appears on the left. The Run Tree displays all the steps in the flow run and their transition messages. The action toolbar at the top enables you to perform actions on the run.

GUI item Description
Action Toolbar The action toolbar shows different icons, depending on the selected panes; Run Log or Run Tree.
Pause   Click to pause the selected run. The run will stop until it's resumed. This is only available for runs that are currently running.
Resume   Click to resume the run. This is only available for runs that are paused.
Cancel   Click to cancel the run.
Reassign   Click to reassign the run to a different user.
Refresh   Click to refresh the run.
Go to Log Tree   If a selected step displays in the Run Tree view, click again to jump to that same step in the Run Log view.
Collapse All   Collapse the Run Tree and display only the top level of the steps.
Step Name

Displays the name of each step in the flow run. Next to each step, an icon displays the step's status.

Click a step to display its details in the Flow Info pane to the right.
Transition Message Displays the transition message for the step, if one exists.

Run Info > Step Details tab (Detailed Step Persistence)

Click the Step Details tab to display information about the currently running step. If you select a step in the Run Tree, the Step Details tab displays details about the selected step.

The fields displayed in the Step Details tab may vary between different types of step.

GUI item Description
Run ID Displays the UUID of the selected run.
Step ID Displays the UUID of the selected step.
Start Time Displays the time when the selected step started.
End Time Displays the time when the selected step ended.
Step Response Displays the response of the selected step, if one exists.
Duration Displays the duration of the selected step.
Inputs

Displays the inputs of the selected step, if these exist.

If you had defined these inputs as sensitive data, they will get encrypted and will appear as asterisks.
Primary Result

Displays the primary result of the selected step, if one exists.

If you had marked the raw result as sensitive, then the primary result will get encrypted and appear as asterisks.
Step Results

Displays the results of the selected step, if any exist.

If you had defined these results as sensitive data, they will get encrypted and appear as asterisks.
Worker Group Displays the worker group of the selected step, if one exists.
Worker ID Displays the UUID of the worker that executed the selected step, if one exists.
Transition Message Displays the message that appears during the transition of the selected step, if one exists.
Step Persistence Detailed.

Run Info > Flow Graph tab

Click the Flow Graph tab to display a graphical view of the flow, with the currently running step highlighted. If you select a step in the Run Tree, the Flow Graph highlights the selected step.

GUI item Description
Zoom In 

Click to increase the size of the flow graph.
Zoom Out 

Click to decrease the size of the flow graph.
Reset 

Click to reset the graph to the default size and position.

Run Log

Click Run Log   to display the Run Log pane with details about the entire run. The action toolbar at the top enables you to perform actions on the run.

GUI item Description
Action Toolbar The action toolbar shows different icons, depending on the selected panes; Run Log or Run Tree.
Pause   Click to pause the selected run. The run will stop until it's resumed. This is only available for runs that are currently running.
Resume   Click to resume the run. This is only available for runs that are paused.
Cancel   Click to cancel the run.
Reassign   Click to reassign the run to a different user.
Refresh   Click to refresh the run.
Go to Run Tree view   If a selected step displays in the Run Tree view, click again to jump to that same step in the Run Log view.
Find Click to open the Find dialog box to locate a step.
After running a search, close the Find dialog box and use the arrows in the toolbar to navigate across the search results.
Export All to Text/CSV   Click to export the run log into a text/CSV file, listing all the events that occurred in the flow run.
Step # Displays the step number of each step
Icon Displays the type of step. Icons represent operation, subflow, return step, and other.
Name Displays the name of the step. If the step is part of a subflow, the step name appears with indentation.
Start Time Displays the time when each step started.
Duration Displays the duration of each step.
Inputs Displays the inputs of each step, if these exist.
Raw Results

Displays the results of each step.

If you had defined these results as sensitive data, they will get encrypted and appear as asterisks.
Response An icon represents the response of each step: Resolved, Error, Diagnosed, No Action Taken.
Transition Displays the description of the outgoing transition, or its name if there is no description.
ROI Displays the ROI of the outgoing transition.
Current Flow Displays the name of the flow containing the step. If there are subflows, this contains the name of the subflow containing the step.
User Displays the run owner at the time the step gets triggered.
Worker Displays the UUID of the worker that executed the step.
Current Flow Displays the name of the current flow.

Run Log > Find dialog box

Use Find in the Run Log to help locate a step that you want to see. Enter one or more search criteria, scrolling down to see those that are hidden. Steps that correspond to the search criteria are highlighted.

GUI item Description
Clear Click to clear the search criteria boxes.
Next Click to highlight the next step that corresponds to the search criteria.
Previous Click to highlight the previous step that corresponds to the search criteria.
You can close the Find dialog box and use the arrows in the toolbar to navigate across the search results.

Flow Information

Click the Down arrow to the right of the flow run name, to expand the Flow Info pane.

GUI item Description
General details Displays basic information about the run, such as start time, duration, user, run ID, and the persistence level, which specifies how the run history gets saved to the database.
Flow ID Displays the UUID (unique identifier) of the flow.
Flow Name Displays the name of the flow.
Path Displays the source path of the flow.
Description

Displays the description of the flow, if one exists. If you can't see all the text in the pane, use the slider to display the text that's lower down in the pane.
Flow Inputs Displays the flow inputs (if any exist).
Flow Outputs Displays the flow output.
Up arrow Click to collapse the Flow Info pane.

Display details about the steps in a flow run

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace.
  2. Click the RUN EXPLORER tab.
  3. Select the flow run that you want to look at in detail.

  4. Click Drill down  at the end of the row to display the drill down information about the selected run.

    To the left, the Run Tree displays the steps in the run and the transition messages. The Run Tree highlights the currently running step and displays information about the progress of the run. If a flow fails, you will see at which step the failure occurred.

    The steps and transition messages are automatically refreshed as the run progresses.

  5. When you click a step in the Run Tree, you display information about that step in the Run Info pane on the right.

    In the Run Info pane, click the Step Details tab to display information about the currently running step. It may include information such as the start time, duration, inputs, results, description, worker group, the ID of the worker that executed the step, and more.

    If you select a step in the Run Tree, the Step Details tab displays details about the selected step.

    The fields displayed in this section will vary between different steps, depending on whether they include inputs, results, and more.

  6. (Optional) You can click  in the toolbar to view the selected step in the Run Log.
  7. Click Back  to return to the main RUN EXPLORER window.

Display the graph of a flow run

You can display a graphical image of a flow run, and highlight the position of the currently running (or selected) step.

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.

  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at in detail, and click Drill down  at the end of the row.

  3. Click a step in the Run Tree on the left.

  4. In the Run Info pane on the right, click the Flow Graph pane to display a graphical view of the flow, with the currently running step highlighted.

    If you select a step in the Run Tree, the Flow Graph highlights the selected step.

  5. You can adjust the way the flow graph appears using the following steps:

    • Drag the flow graph across the screen, to display elements that aren't visible.
    • Click zoom to increase or decrease the size of the flow graph.
    • Click Reset   to reset the view to the default size and position.

Display the Run Log with details of the entire run

The Run Log is a table with information about the entire run (steps, start time, duration, inputs, results, and more). This information is useful for identifying issues about a run while troubleshooting.

The Run Log displays a maximum of 500 runs in one page to meet performance requirements. Runs with over 500 steps are displayed on multiple pages. You can use the paging functionality to navigate through the pages.

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.

  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click Drill down  at the end of the row.

  3. Click Run Log   to toggle between expanding and collapsing display the Run Log pane, with details about the entire run.

    If the run includes subflows, the relevant steps are indented.

  4. For runs of over 500 steps, which are displayed in multiple pages, navigate through the pages:

    • Click arrow 
    • Enter the number of a specific page

  5. To hide or display columns, click Select Columns  to display the column picker. Select the check box next to a column name to display that column or clear the check box to hide it.

    When you hide a column, this doesn't affect the results if you run a search.

  6. You can click Run Tree   to collapse the Run Log pane and show the Run Tree. Or click  in the toolbar to view the selected step in the Run Tree.

Find a step in the Run Log

In a long run, it may be difficult to find a particular step. Use Find to help locate the step that you want to see.

Searching in the Run Log is only supported if the storage space taken up by the searched field is no more than 4,000 bytes. Note that Japanese and Chinese take up about 3 bytes per character, while other (non English) languages take up about 1.5 bytes per character. Also note that in the case of transition descriptions, the 4,000 bytes are shared among all the locales in which the description is available.

  1. Click Run Management, and then click the RUN EXPLORER tab.

  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click Drill down  at the end of the row.

  3. Click Table view  to display the Run Log pane.

  4. Click Find to display the Find dialog box.

  5. Enter the search criteria, scrolling down to see those that are hidden.

    This isn't a filter. Steps that correspond to the search criteria are highlighted, but the non selected steps are displayed, so that you can see the context of the highlighted steps.

  6. Click Next to highlight, in turn, each step that corresponds to the search criteria.

  7. If desired, you can close the Find dialog box and use the Next and Previous arrows in the toolbar to navigate across the search results.

Toggle between viewing a step in the Run Tree and Flow Graph and in the Run Log

You can move in either direction:

  • If the selected step shows displays in the Run Tree view, you can jump to that same step in the Run Log to display more information about that step.
  • If the selected step shows displays in the Run Tree view, you can jump to that same step in the Run Log and Flow Graph, to see how the step fits into the overall picture of the flow.
  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.
  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click Drill down  at the end of the row.
  3. When you select a step in the Run Tree, click  to display the Run Log with the selected step highlighted.
  4. When you select a step in the Run Log, click  to display the Run Tree with the selected step highlighted. The selected step is also highlighted in the Flow Graph.

Collapse the run tree

You can collapse the steps of an expanded Run Tree using the following steps:

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.
  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click Drill down   at the end of the row.
  3. Click the steps in the Run Tree to expand them, and display subflows and lanes.
  4. Click the Collapse All  to collapse the Run Tree and display only the top level of the steps.

Adjust the width of the Run info pane

You can use the slider at the edge of the Run Info pane to adjust its size.

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.
  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click the Drill down  at the end of the row.
  3. Drag the edge of the slider to adjust the width of the Run Info pane.
  4. Use the open/close in the slider to toggle between expanding and collapsing the pane .

Display details about the flow

While drilling down to a flow run, you can view details about the original flow, such as flow UUID, flow name, path, description, flow inputs, flow outputs, and more.

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.

  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click the Drill down  at the end of the row.

  3. Click the Down arrow  to the right of the flow run name, to expand the Flow Info pane.

  4. If you can't see all the text in the pane, use the slider to display the text that's lower down in the pane.
  5. Click the Up arrow to collapse the Flow Info pane.

Export the Run Log as a text file

You can export the Run Log into a text file, listing all the steps' logs, which occurred in the flow run. This can help identify the causes of a problem. It may be useful to send this file to the flow author when a flow needs fixing.

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.

  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click Drill down  at the end of the row.

  3. Click Table View  to display the Run Log pane.

  4. Click the Export and from the drop down, select .

    An icon with the name of the text file appears at the lower edge of the OO window. You can click it to open the file in your default text editor.

  5. You can send the text file to the flow author, when requesting a change to a flow.

Export the Run Log as a CSV file

You can export the Run Log into a CSV file, listing all the steps' logs, which occurred in the flow run. This can help identify the causes of a problem. It may be useful to send this file to the flow author, when a flow needs fixing.

To open the CSV file in Excel, make sure to configure the Excel correctly for character encoding. For more information, see http://superuser.com/questions/280603/how-to-set-character-encoding-when-opening-excel.

  1. Click Run Management to display the Run Management workspace, and click the RUN EXPLORER tab.

  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at, and click Drill down  at the end of the row.

  3. Click Table View    to display the Run Log pane.

  4. Click Export and from the drop down, select .

    An icon with the name of the CSV file appears at the lower edge of the OO window. You can click it to open the CSV file in Excel.

  5. You can send the CSV file to the flow author, when requesting a change to a flow.

Related topics

To run a flow from OO Central, see Run a flow.
